== Approval Application for Greek Team (ubuntu-gr) ==

The Greek Ubuntu LoCo team started in 2005 with a simple website and a mailing list. Since then our LoCo has become one of the largest FOSS communities in Greece. We run a website, a wiki, a mailing list, a forum and an irc channel so we can exchange ideas, promote Ubuntu and FOSS in general, support users and help the development to Ubuntu.

* ''<nowiki>[[http://www.edubuntu.gr|Edubuntu.gr]]</nowiki>'' - Creation of a Greek speaking Edubuntu website. Most Edubuntu and Ubuntu documentation gets translated in Greek. Work in progress. (by Kainouriakis Giorgos).
* ''<nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu-gr.org/Community/Marketing/ReserveCds|CD shipping]]</nowiki>'' - We distribute our Loco CD package to events all around Greece. So far, we distributed our Ubuntu CD allocation to ten events throughout Greece. (by Athanasios Lefteris, Giorgos Logiotatidis)
* ''<nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu-gr.org/Community/Marketing/CDArtwork|Professional Greek CD Labels]]</nowiki>'' - We created high quality Greek CD wallets-labels for version 7.10 & 8.04 based on Canonicals official wallets-labels. (by Stavros Temertzidis)
* ''Website administration and maintenance'' - We run a Drupal website at http://ubuntu-gr.org, a documentation Wiki at http://wiki.ubuntu-gr.org (by the <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu-gr.org/Community/Teams/WebsiteTeam|WebTeam]]</nowiki>)
* Our <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.opengr.net|Ubuntu-gr]]</nowiki> forum started in mid-May 2008 and currently we have over 800 members and 11000 post in 1100 threads. The forum is very active and among others, it provides support for new users of Ubuntu Linux that just completed the installation, or they are planning to switch to Linux. The forum is maintained by the <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu-gr.org/Community/Teams/WebsiteTeam|WebTeam]]</nowiki>.
* ''Mailing list management'' - We run a mailing list at ubuntu-gr@lists.ubuntu.com. (by Giorgos Logiotatidis)
* ''Localisation'' - We assisted the Greek GNOME localisation effort in the <nowiki>[[http://l10n.gnome.org/languages/el/gnome-2-22|translation update for GNOME 2.22]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://l10n.gnome.org/languages/el/gnome-2-24|GNOME 2.24]]</nowiki>, updated translations for Ubuntu-specific applications, fixed translation errors during beta/RC period. (by <nowiki>[[http://wiki.gnome.gr/doku.php?id=translation:credits222|various community members]]</nowiki>, lead by <nowiki>[[http://simos.info/blog|Simos Xenitellis]]</nowiki>)
